required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise, Gut Microbiota in Sedentary Adults With Overweight
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Two Exercise Programme on Gut Microbiota, Hepatic Metabolism and Adipokines in Sedentary Adults With Overweight

brief_summary.textblock: This project offers the opportunity to obtain detailed measurements on the health of body composition, metabolic health, and intestinal microbial diversity in overweight adults; moreover to provide information about the effects of physical exercise on them. The aim of the research is to advance in the understanding of the mechanisms induced by physical exercise, which includes the measurement of nutritional parameters, clinical and biochemical biomarkers of hepatic/cardiometabolic health, as well as the application of differential proteomics technologies by means of Arrays of cytokines and intestinal microbiome, making this study a novel and pioneer in sensitive areas of primary health care in Latin America.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study halted prematurely, prior to enrollment of first participant due to PI not employment at University.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the gut microbiota composition measured by amplicon sequencing

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the metabolomic profile will be also evaluated by a HPLC-MS approach

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the Chemerin will be measured using ELISA kits

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the Selenoprotein P will be measured using ELISA kits

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the Fetuin-A will be measured using ELISA kits

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the FGF21 (fibroblast growth factor 21) Leukocyte cell-derived will be measured using ELISA kits

secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline will be also evaluated by a spectroscopy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline will be also evaluated by a ELISA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline will be also evaluated by a ELISA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline measure of plasma IL-1 concentrations measured ELISA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends

secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline measure of plasma TNF-alfa concentrations measured ELISA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in body weight (kilograms) measured by DXA

secondary_outcome.description: Differences in body fat (%) measured by DXA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in mass muscle measured by DXA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in Muscular strength (handgrip test) in kg

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in Maximum Oxygen Consumption (VO2 max K5 Gas Analyser) in ml/kg/min

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Fat and carbohydrate oxidation in the fasted and postprandial state measured before and after the interventions using indirect calorimetry (K5 cosmed)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 6 weeks immediately after the interventions ends
secondary_outcome.description: Resting metabolic rate was measured before and after the interventions (K5 Cosmed)

arm_group.description: The HIIT modality consisted of 30-40 minutes (min) of steady-state, high-intensity training 3 d/wk on a stationary bicycle at the target heart rate (HR) range equivalent to 85% to 95% of the individual's maximum oxygen consumption rate (VO2max). Exercise will be performed at three sessions per week. All sessions will be supervised by an exercise physiologist during 6-weeks.

The SIT modality consisted of 6 to 10 repetitions of a 30 s segment of all-out exercise interspersed with 2 min of recovery, 3 d/wk on a stationary bicycle at the target heart rate (HR) range equivalent to 90% to 95% of the individual's maximum oxygen consumption rate (VO2max).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy
- Sedentary males
- BMI>25 kg/m2, on a stable body weight for the last 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute or chronic illness
- Use of antibiotics the past 2 months
- Smoking
